title: 1930 PGA Championship
text:
The 1930 PGA Championship was the 13th <a href="PGA%20Championship">PGA Championship</a>, held September 8–13 in <a href="New%20York%20City">New York City</a> at <a href="Fresh%20Meadow%20Country%20Club">Fresh Meadow Country Club</a> in <a href="Flushing%2C%20Queens">Flushing</a>, <a href="Queens">Queens</a>. Then a <a href="match%20play">match play</a> championship, <a href="Tommy%20Armour">Tommy Armour</a> defeated <a href="Gene%20Sarazen">Gene Sarazen</a> 1 up in the finals for the second of his three <a href="Men%27s%20major%20golf%20championships">major</a> titles. 
<a href="Johnny%20Farrell">Johnny Farrell</a> and <a href="Horton%20Smith">Horton Smith</a> were co-medalists at 145 (+5) in the 36-hole <a href="stroke%20play">stroke play</a> qualifier on Monday. Two-time defending champion <a href="Leo%20Diegel">Leo Diegel</a> lost in the second round to Harold Sampson in 38 holes, ending his bid for a third straight title. Runner-up Sarazen was the club pro at Fresh Meadow; he previously won the PGA Championship in <a href="1922%20PGA%20Championship">1922</a> and <a href="1923%20PGA%20Championship">1923</a>.
During the 36-hole <a href="Monday%20qualifier">Monday qualifier</a>, Diegel shot 81 in the morning round and was in danger of not advancing to match play. He followed up with a 69 (–1) in the afternoon and his 150 (+10) put him only five strokes behind the medalists, in a tie for 8th place, easily within the top 32. Starting in <a href="1931%20PGA%20Championship">1931</a>, the defending champion was exempt from qualifying.
The course where this PGA Championship was played in <a href="Queens">Queens</a> no longer exists. Designed by <a href="A.%20W.%20Tillinghast">A. W. Tillinghast</a>, it opened in 1923 and also hosted the <a href="U.S.%20Open%20%28golf%29">U.S. Open</a> in <a href="1932%20U.S.%20Open%20%28golf%29">1932</a>, won by Sarazen. Under increasing development and tax pressure, the Fresh Meadow Country Club sold the property in 1946, which was developed as a residential neighborhood (the <a href="Fresh%20Meadows%2C%20Queens">Fresh Meadows</a> section of Queens). The club then purchased the property, clubhouse, and golf course of the defunct Lakeville Golf & Country Club in <a href="Lake%20Success%2C%20New%20York">Lake Success</a>, its current home.
Format.
The <a href="match%20play">match play</a> format at the PGA Championship in 1930 called for 12 rounds (216 holes) in six days:
Final results.
"Saturday, September 13, 1930"
